bug.short_desc: The manual page for "dig" doesn't format properly
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When doing "man dig" I see a page where the roff directives show, and the formatting is broken.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): bind-utils-9.10.4-2.P4.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Every time
Steps to Reproduce: 1. man dig
Actual results: A page that starts:
.SH "NAME" dig - DNS lookup utility .SH "SYNOPSIS" .HP 4
Expected results: A page starting like this:
NAME dig - DNS lookup utility
SYNOPSIS dig [@server] ...
(With the headers in boldface.)
Additional info: Looking at the source in /usr/share/man/man1/dig.1.gz all the roff directives are indented. That wasn't legal formatting in the time I wrote this kind of documents. It seems it is still not legal.
The other manual pages in bind-utils look good. This problem only happens for "dig".
*** Bug 1398547 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Reported as ISC-Bugs #43831 upstream. The bug is related to https://sourceforge.net/p/docbook/bugs/1381/
Temporary workaround is before compilation: find . -name '*.docbook' -exec sed -e 's,xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook",xmlns:db="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook",' -i '{}' ';'
Waiting for upstream for response.
